name: NPR
text:
Stock prices plummeted Wednesday, amid fears that a spike in coronavirus cases in parts of the country could force the economy into another lockdown.
https://t.co/jwMc9OnJdO

name: NPR
text:
More and more cyclists are taking on “Everesting” — climbing the height equal to Mount Everest by riding a single hill, up and down, over and over again. 

Lachlan Morton just set a record: He finished in seven hours, 29 minutes and 57 seconds.
https://t.co/VB9wIEV1B5

name: NPR
text:
"Very few Americans have created all of their wealth on their own; it's passed down through generations and then built upon," journalist @nhannahjones says.

"You cannot close a racial wealth gap without transferring wealth."
https://t.co/yJTaCj3L3A

name: NPR
text:
Anti-racist protests in Washington State were not a catalyst for the spread of COVID-19, according to a state public health official. 

"What we're finding is, in large part, that's due to the use of masks," she said.
https://t.co/nqtrMns9LF
